alert.note: Alert for Barton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 09 at 6:12AM CDT until August 09 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Barton County in central Kansas... * Until 900 AM CDT. * At 612 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement has reported multiple roads in Great Bend and Hoisington flooded and impassable. Some of the water is considered fast moving. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Great Bend, Hoisington, Albert, Olmitz, Galatia, Susank, Great Bend Airport and Cheyenne Bottoms. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
